item.title: World War Z is Getting a The Walking Dead Crossover in January
item.content:encoded:
Saber Interactive has announced that the next cmapaign for World War Z will be a crossover with AMC’s The Walking Dead.

Launching in January 2026, the World War Z x The Walking Dead crossover will see players experience the relentless undead in three new story chapters. Players will be able to play as iconic characters from The Walking Dead universe, including Rick Grimes, Michonne, Negan, and Daryl Dixon.

The new crossover event will launch for the PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S|X, and PC.

You can watch the announcement video below:

Are you looking forward to the World War Z x The Walking Dead crossover event? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Horizon Clone lawsuit being settled with Light of Motiram delisted. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Universal Tower Defense Season 1 Battlepass: All Rewards, Premium Price And More
item.content:encoded:
This guide will give you all the relevant details regarding the Roblox Universal Tower Defense Season 1 battlepass, letting you decide if the premium pass is actually worth

Universal Tower Defense debuted with Update 0, which introduced new Units, Items, maps, and the Season 1 Battlepass. Like most Roblox games, the UTD Battlepass comes in two versions: Premium Plan and Free Plan. The former, as you guessed, costs 799 Robux, while the latter is for those who prefer not to spend any. The Free Plan offers the same kind of rewards as its counterpart, but in smaller quantities. Additionally, the Battlepass includes Tier Skips and a bundle, all of which also require Robux. This article breaks down all the Season 1 Battlepass rewards in Universal Tower Defense, along with their descriptions and pricing details.

Universal Tower Defense Season 1 Battlepass Explained

Prices: 

  • Premium Plan – 799 Robux
  • Battlepass Bundle – 4999 Robux


Tier Skips:

  • 1x Tier Skip – 119 Robux
  • 10x Tier Skip – 999 Robux 

Season 1 Battlepass Rewards List:

Universal Tower Defense Season 1 Battlepass Rewards Breakdown

  • Gems – Used to summon Units. 
  • Gold – Found all over the different maps. Use this currency to purchase Items and upgrade Relics. 
  • Stat Rerolls – Rerolls the combat values of a unit from F all the way up to SSS. 
  • Trait Rerolls – Change the Trait of your Units to make them more powerful. 
  • Footballer Unit – A good early game Unit that does ample amounts of damage. Another perk is that you can easily claim this Unit for free by reaching level 25 on the pass. 
  • Rule Unit – Rule is an exclusive Unit that is considered one of the finest capable of inflicting tremendous amounts of damage in a short time.

Enjoying our Roblox games codes coverage? Check out the codes for popular games like Steal A Brainrot, Radiant Residents, and Fix It Up on Insider Gaming!

Interested in the latest developments in the world of gaming and esports? Then join the Insider Gaming Discord server and engage with the passionate community.

item.title: Pet Capture Adventure Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Pet Capture Adventure monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Gold Coins and much more.

Pet Capture Adventure is a Roblox experience built around exploration, combat, and building a powerful collection of creatures. Players travel through different zones to catch pets with varying strengths, rarities, and abilities, then train them to perform better in battles. The long-term goal is to obtain rare pets, improve their stats through upgrades, and progress through increasingly challenging areas and bosses.

The game’s progression revolves around its primary currency, Gold Coins, which players earn by defeating wild pets, completing quests, and winning gym battles. These coins are essential for purchasing capture devices, training equipment, and special items that enhance your pets’ abilities. While Gold Coins can be earned through regular gameplay, the most efficient way to accelerate your adventure is by redeeming promo codes. Developers periodically release codes that grant free currency and bonuses, helping players strengthen their teams without excessive grinding.

Active Pet Capture Adventure Codes

  • GXEWXZ: 20 Gold Coins
  • XZZP11: Free Rewards
  • AKDL11: 20 Gold Coins

Expired Pet Capture Adventure Codes

  • Welcome

How To Redeem Pet Capture Adventure Codes

Like most Roblox games, redeeming codes in Pet Capture Adventure is easy and rather simple. That being said, here are the steps for new players:

  1. Boot Pet Capture Adventure on Roblox
  2. Click on the Store icon on the left side of the screen
  3. Then click on the Codes option in the Store
  4. Enter the code in the empty box given
  5. Click on Redeem to claim the free rewards

How To Get More Pet Capture Adventure Codes

Pet Capture Adventure codes are typically released through the game’s community and developer channels, but they don’t appear automatically in-game. The best places to catch them early are the official Discord server, the Roblox game page, and the creators’ social accounts where they post updates and announcements. That includes the Sleeping Dogs Club by BaofuBaoshou2, who is the creator, where they post codes occasionally.

Codes often come out around updates, new features, or special events, but if you’re only checking sporadically you’ll very easily miss them because there’s no alert system that tells players when a code drops—or when it stops working.

Because of this, the easiest strategy is to save this guide in your browser and check back instead of trying to monitor every source yourself. This page is refreshed as soon as fresh codes go live, and any codes that have expired are taken out quickly so you always see only the ones that still work.

Be sure to check out our Insider Gaming Discord Server, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best gem-hunting Roblox games.

If you’re a big fan of Roblox and play a lot of games, you can also check out our code guides for other popular Roblox titles like Steal an Anime, Steal Star Wars, and Mini Empires.

item.title: Fortnite Return To iOS In Japan Has Been Blocked
item.content:encoded:
Epic Games CEO has revealed that Fortnite will not return to iOS in Japan in 2025, firing shots at Apple for obstructing its release.

Epic Games has been fighting hard to bring Fortnite back to iOS devices worldwide, but has faced major roadblocks from Apple. After releasing Fortnite in the EU, Apple blocked the game on iOS, preventing its release in the US. Now, it seems a similar situation has occurred in Japan.

Fortnite Will Not Return to iOS in Japan in 2025

A new post by Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney on X (formerly Twitter) reveals that Fortnite’s return to iOS in Japan has been blocked. The post reveals that Apple was supposed to “open up iOS to competing stores today, and instead of doing so honestly, they have launched another travesty of obstruction and lawbreaking in gross disrespect to the government and people of Japan.” The CEO proceeded to present more facts in the thread.

Sweeney revealed that Apple is charging “a competition-crushing 21% junk fee on third-party in-app payments, and 15% for purchases made on the web.” Explaining that this practice has been “found to be illegal in the contempt of court proceeding that Apple lost, and the 9th Circuit Court upheld.” Additionally, Sweeney stated that Apple is presenting users with “new anticompetitive warning screens meant to mislead customers into believing their privacy and financial security are at risk when dealing with Apple competitors.”

The Epic Games CEO added that Apple is “imposing a new 5% junk fee on all revenue from apps distributed by competing stores, and intend to surveil all transactions within them using a mandatory reporting API.” He has also stated that they will be raising their complaints with the Japanese Fair Trade Commission.

In other news, Fortnite has announced a $2.5 million Reload Elite Series finals at the Esports World Cup. Additionally, here are the Fortnite December 18 update & Winterfest 2025 patch notes. What are your thoughts on Fortnite’s return to iOS in Japan being blocked?

item.title: Starfield 2026 Update Rumoured to Bring Quicker Space Flights, PS5 & Switch 2 Ports and More
item.content:encoded:
According to new rumours, Bethesda Game Studios showcased Starfield’s 2026 update behind closed doors, featuring PS5 and Switch 2 ports, Space Flight improvements, and more.

Starfield’s new update has been a subject of question since the start of 2025. The developers have mentioned another DLC several times, but we have yet to release any confirmed details. There have also been rumours about a Switch 2 port and new space flight features, which new rumours have seemingly confirmed.

Starfield 2026 Update Reportedly Showcased Behind Closed Doors

A new report by WindowsCentral discusses rumours that Starfield’s 2026 update was recently showcased behind closed doors. These rumours state that Bethesda has been working to improve Starfield’s spaceflight mechanics and to step away from loading screens for “more free-form and continuous” traversal. The game’s Creation Engine has received significant technical improvements to enhance the spaceflight system, and the improvements will be used in future games as well.

Additionally, the Starfield 2026 update is also rumoured to bring the highly anticipated PlayStation 5 and Switch 2 ports next year. The developers have been working on optimising the title for “low power” devices like handhelds. However, sources are unable to agree on the scale of the update. Some say it won’t be on par with Cyberpunk 2.0, while others are optimistic. Readers should treat this information with caution as it doesn’t come from an official source.

In other news, Bethesda teased ‘Terran Armada’ in an anniversary post. Additionally, the PS5 port for the title will not be announced this year according to a recent claim. What are your thoughts on Starfield’s 2026 update bringing quicker space flights, PS5, and Switch 2 ports? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Horizon Clone lawsuit being settled with Light of Motiram delisted. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
